@jack The best shot at making PoW mining distributed again is for BTC to switch to hash functions that makes it uneconomical to build ASIC.

E.g:RandomX hash is a mini CPU simulator that favors CPUs over special ASICs/GPUs which means any device with a CPU can participate again.

Permissionless Blockchains doesn't mean no permission required. 

It means less permissions required
What are some of the Quantum-resistant-first Blockchain projects out there ?

We did this by embedding FPGA in our ASIC design to handle any control logic changes the XMR team would often make & attaching multiple hardened components around the FPGA in the SoC to accelerate the most time consuming parts of the CryptoNite hash function(FMA & RAM access) https://t.co/HXzOM8bnun
We designed our ASIC at the time to be future proof of their changes which wouldn't have required us to spin new ASIC(like Bitamin was doing) although at a slightly reduced performance.
Most of the code changes they would make to invalidate ASIC were happening in the "control logic" of the hashfunction which one could tell there wasn't hardware person involved as part of their mods.

I remember when Monero tried to be "ASIC resistant" by hard forking every 6 months often with just one line of code in the hash function at the time (CryptoNite) to invalidate or pre-emptively invalidate any upcoming ASIC hardware. 

It wasn't the best idea...
To prevent "finding encryption keys" is next major focus for Blockchains? https://t.co/XpYuhnTcMg

My tradecraft transitions over time:

Started with writing code before Operating system boots(Firmware)

Then moved on to writing code when OS is booting(Kernel)

Then moved on writing code that the OS boots on(Hardware RTL)

Now I write code that runs in the browser(JavaScript)

Mainly because Nvidia chips are designed for massive parallel data processing unlike CPUs which are designed primarily for tasks based parallel processing.

Gaming, AI, Crypto, Metaverse are all about crunching fast data fast.
Makes sense why $NVDA is one of the top performing tech stocks so far this year. https://t.co/vImrHUD7DE

Nvidia chips are proving to be timeless

They were first made for gaming

..and when AI came along, they are great for it.

..and when crypto mining came along, they're great for it.

And if the Metaverse becomes reality, Nvidia is poised to again benefit the most.
